bibliographic_metadata.Title: Deep learning and fractal-wavelet techniques for magnetite-apatite exploration in Tarom Iran
bibliographic_metadata.Author: Mohammad Mahdi Pourgholam, Ahmad Adib, Peyman Afzal, Kambiz Rahbar, Mehran Gholinejad

abstract: This study proposes an approach to detect iron-apatite mineralization and paragenesis related to Iron deposits by applying an image fusion based on deep learning (FDL) on exploration datasets. The exploration dataset includes remote-sensing, airborne geophysics, stream sediment geochemistry, and geological maps. The Prospectivity model was based on logical relations between each layer or sublayer extracted features and classes. The results indicate potential regions as Mineral Prospectivity Map (MPM) using fusion-based deep learning algorithms.
methodology: supervised > deep learning > CNN; supervised > deep learning > ResNet; supervised > deep learning > VGG-19; supervised > deep learning > GoogleNet; supervised > deep learning > AlexNet
key_points: Integration of multiple data types for mineral exploration.
Use of deep learning for anomaly detection.
High correlation between MPM and field sampling results.
Automated class boundaries via wavelet norms.
